answers.answer: A round hole leading to detachment is probably less than 0.5%  There is a slight increase in risk due to the RD in the other eye, but probably not from the round hole.  5% complications with laser treatment --epiretinal membrane formation and detachment.  Pay attentions to symptoms in that eye and see a retinal specialist immediate if you have changes in floaters or flashes or change in peripheral vision.I do not think the stats you mentioned are correct.  There are about 10,000 to 15,000 retinal detachment per year unrelated to other eye disease such as diabetes, cataract surgery or trauma.  We do about 3 million cataract surgeries per year.I would not have laser (I have a very similar situation).
